title: Zenato 2013 Sergio Zenato Riserva  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, mature orchard fruit, and baking spice open. The medium-bodied palate offers yellow apple skin, grapefruit, butterscotch and toasted nut alongside bright acidity. A graphite note signals the close.

title: Whitecliff Vineyard 2012 Petite Verdot (New York)
description: Inky black cherries and plums add lushness to this tight, taut Petit Verdot. Crisp and medium-bodied in style, it's elegantly framed by a fringe of firm, velvety tannins. Drink now through 2020.

title: Tuck Beckstoffer 2012 The Sum Seventy Five Wine Co. Red (California)
description: Gushing with bright strawberry and raspberry aromas and flavors, this wine tastes fresh and delicious, lively and fun. It's dry, well balanced, moderately tannic, and has an appetizing, grippy texture.
designation: The Sum Seventy Five Wine Co.

title: Château Saint-Maur 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: One of the Côtes de Provence classed growths, this wine is soft and rounded. Its fresh, lightly candied character is offset by the firmer tannins from Syrah and Mourvèdre in the blend. Ripe and full and fruity in the mouth, it has only light acidity at the end.

title: Conn Creek 2014 Red Hills Rosé (Lake County)
description: A very light color and reserved aromas and flavors make this dry wine appetizing in a subtle way. Made from Malbec grapes, which is unusual for rosé, it should pair well with seafood or almost anything you would serve a dry white wine with.

title: Corner 103 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Flat aromas of coconut and toasted oak give way to smoky chocolate mocha, red currant and black pepper. A touch soft on the finish, it otherwise drinks full-bodied and powerful.

title: Cuvaison 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a simple, straightforward combination of apple and caramel, light-bodied with layers of texture and complexity. A great midweek wine that works for larger gatherings as well, it's a great example of cool-climate fruit that isn't overdone in oak or ripeness.

title: Deltetto 2015 San Michele  (Roero)
description: Aromas of white spring flower, exotic fruit and an herbal note waft out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers white peach, pear, vanilla and toasted oak alongside modest acidity. A citrusy note closes the finish.

title: Château Pas du Cerf 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With its name going back to 16th-century stag hunting by King Francis I, this chateau offers a perfumed, deliciously ripe wine that is light and poised at the same time. An herbal touch partners with the red fruits for extra freshness.

title: Château Réal d'Or 2015 Collection Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With vineyards at Maures in the heart of Côtes de Provence, this château has produced a rich, sunny style of wine. With ripe strawberry flavors and a soft texture gently cut by acidity, the wine is made for apéritif.

title: Calera 2015 Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Josh Jensen enters his fourth decade of pink wine with this bottling, which shows ripe strawberry, red apple, white peach, plum and red cherry on the fleshy and full now. It tightens up on the palate, showing tart berries, orange peels and pencil lead minerality, finishing with a long stroke of cherry-watermelon. Lots of depth for a rosé.
designation: Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Vin Gris of

title: Vinos de Arganza 2013 Flavium Selección Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Baking-spice aromas are out front, followed by notes of chocolate, berry fruits and smoke. This feels ripe, tannic and chewy, while flavors of toast and spice accent blackberry fruit. Flavors of oak, mint, coffee and hard spices control a slightly hot finish.

title: 12 Linajes 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, loamy aromas of raisin and prune feature a dash of baking spices and licorice root. This is quite jammy and widespread, with ripeness outweighing precision. Blueberry, prune and mocha flavors finish raisiny and soft.

title: Battaglio 2015 Piasi  (Roero)
description: This is delicately scented with aromas suggesting white spring wild flower and a hint of white stone fruit. The soft, fresh palate offers Bartlett pear, juicy citrus and yellow peach while a note of bitter hazelnut closes the finish.

title: Bluenose 2012 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine doesn't try to conceal what it is, a 100% varietal exploration of a hearty grape, though in this case, from a relatively cool area. Black-purple in color, it offers structure and tension atop developed flavors of mocha chocolate and plum.

title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2012 Finca Rableros Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)
description: Tomato and spiced plum aromas are lightly earthy and a touch rubbery. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo feels ripe and juicy, not rough or scratchy. Plum, berry and spice flavors finish with a shot of pomegranate and red currant.

title: Moshin 2013 Calliope Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This vineyard-designate pushes the envelope in terms of ripeness, opting to go for a restrained, low-alcohol style. It retains a streak of menthol through a juicy red core of strawberry and oak-toasted tannin, finishing lean.

title: Ruca Malen 2012 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Rooty, spicy aromas of cola and herbal plum are slightly smoky and leafy. This is fleshy and open on the palate, with spicy, herbal flavors of tomato, tea and black plum. A similar herbal, meaty quality lasts onto the finish.

title: La Bollina 2015  Gavi
description: White spring flower and citrus fruit aromas lead the way while the bright palate offers juicy nectarine and a hint of papaya. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.

title: Rancho Maria 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine opens with a candied, grapy, almost baked plum kind of ripeness that's fruity, approachable and likable. It benefits from a bite of muscled tannin that is tamed on the finish. Oak aging took place for 22 months in French barrels.

title: Rare NV Grape 4 Blend Rosé (California)
description: This wine tastes like a rosé Champagne without the bubbles. It has a classic light salmon color, light aromas like white cherries and raspberries, and a surprisingly layered texure that curls around the tongue. And what a great value, too.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Champelle Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: Situated between the two mountain ranges of Saint-Baume and Sainte-Victoire, this estate is dry and relatively cool in the summer. That produces this fresh, lightly pink-colored wine that has a smooth caramel flavor and rich strawberry fruits. The aftertaste is soft and ripe.

title: Raymond 2013 Small Lot Collection Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: A small addition of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot don't rein in any of this wine's significant power, highlighted in plummy licorice and inviting aromas of chocolate that mellow on the palate, revealing a thick and rich explosion of ripeness with a concentrated finish.

title: Tie-Dye 2013 Red (North Coast)
description: Big, bold and dry in style, this hearty wine with a 1960s-theme label has aromas like ripe black grapes with a slight earthy accent, and tastes opulent, generous and spicy.

title: Sanford 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A bit light in aromas, this appellation blend slowly shows dried cranberry, slight raspberry, juniper and wet earth. The clean but simple flavors surround iron, more dried cranberry and a pinch of dried herbs.

title: L'original French Kiss NV Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: Ripe red berries, cherries and plums lead the bouquet of this friendly and approachable red. Those notes follow through to the creamy palate, while accents of carnation and pressed violet petals add depth and interest. A hint of sweet spice accents the finish.

title: Quara 2015 Estate Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Floral tropical-fruit aromas start out strong but break up and turn a bit oily upon airing. Solid on the palate, this tastes of lychee, mango and white pineapple. Good acidity preserves the finish.

title: Pierre Moulin 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)
description: Produced in the Languedoc, this wine tastes of the warmth and the sun. It has a touch of butter as well as ripe green-plum fruits. Acidity gives an attractive lift to this fruity, soft wine.

title: Geyser Peak 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine is serious in style, starting with a dark color, then concentrated aromas like pomegranate juice, black olive and blackberry come through. It is full bodied and moderately tannic for the kind of dense texture that's great with meat and cheese.

title: Gianni Gagliardo 2009 Preve Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Aromas espresso, toasted oak and a whiff of exotic spice lead the nose while the evolved palate shows mocha, oak and a note of dried black cherry before a rather abrupt finish. It's shy on freshness and lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the dominant wood sensations.
